content.label: Been playing this for about a year, been through the whole field about 4 times and only got stuck once.  I find it relaxing and absorbing.  My only frustration is that on the main screen occasionally There will be a challenge that is impossible to accomplish in the available spots.

title.label: The best game on my phone

content.label:
I‚Äôve had this game for two years now, and I can‚Äôt believe that I haven‚Äôt written a review yet! It‚Äôs my second most used app (aside from YouTube)
And the best purchase that I‚Äôve made on my phone to this day! I love the gameplay and how there is no ‚Äúhand holding‚Äù along the way. It‚Äôs just you, your thoughts and the stunning graphics. I finished the main story in a mere month, but I still play it all the time! The addition of the cave with it‚Äôs daily challenge is really fun! If anyone is confused about what it does; it gives you more flowers at a higher level in the beginning spawn. And the music is fantastic! I have no complaints about this game!

very well put game. i liked how there‚Äôs no instructions because then it got my mind to think what i really needed to do. i hope with the update there will be more levels, i finished this game in about 3 days but i was constantly playing so if you don‚Äôt have that kind of time it will probably take you longer to complete. it would be a bummer if there will no longer be any further levels because of the price paid.

I appreciate the lack of hand-holding. So many games have tutorials that walk you through every little detail; it can feel like being a kindergartener. Evergarden dropped me into its puzzle and let me work out the rules myself, which became part of the fun. There‚Äôs a mysterious feeling to this game, as though it‚Äôs a single piece of some larger world.
The gameplay is reminiscent of Triple Town (or 2048/Threes), combining small-valued flowers into bigger ones, but the mechanism is different. And then there‚Äôs a larger matching game overlaying that, and I‚Äôve just gotten to some mini-games that unlock new powers and reveal bits of what may be a story...
Highly recommended if you enjoy thoughtful puzzles and tranquil moods.

Extremely annoying little game, with no sense of progress. Stuck on the first level with no sign of it ever ending or the option to play another one.

Wouldn‚Äôt buy it again

The game has a lot of depth which I appreciate but I‚Äôm now at a dead end. I couldn‚Äôt put it down at first but now I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm stuck or if I solved everything. I‚Äôm not sure if it is supposed to advance after you unlock the 4 light pillars somehow or if you really only have the beginning board once this part is done. If so then it‚Äôs a waste of money. Free apps offer more entertainment.

The game
Is fun and relaxing. Thank goodness they added the feature to let you exit the game and come back to finish.

I don‚Äôt mind the lack of instructions but I can‚Äôt
Figure out the cave.   I‚Äôve solved 7+ puzzles there but I never seem to get a reward.  What‚Äôs the point of the cave?

I turned my last two plants into a monolith with four moves left. I couldn‚Äôt use up my growing turns because there was ‚Äúnothing to grow‚Äù. But I couldn‚Äôt plant anything because I didn‚Äôt have anything to plant. Lost all my earned triangles and points because I had to start over in this predicament. Otherwise it‚Äôs a pretty mediocre game. Fine to play in the background of watching tv, or killing time. Not a super satisfying narrative, and would have appreciated if the field of play changed shape or something as the game went on.

I really enjoyed playing this game! I couldn‚Äôt put it down for three hours straight after opening it for the first time.

I wish I could save games and return to them though. As I‚Äôve been playing on the go I‚Äôve had trouble finishing a game in under 10 minutes and then I lose my progress because I push the game to the background.

Overall though, I really enjoy this game and it is worth the $5. :)
The puzzles are fun, but it‚Äôs a great story too, it takes some time to get through to the end, but once you did it‚Äôs a great message.  I really enjoyed it.

I really regret spending money on this game. I played it for a few days but never found the point. I thought there would be more to it than just combining flowers to make bigger ones to get triangles to do it somewhere else. Totally not worth it in my opinion.

...this game destroys your battery life - probably by 50% in 45 minutes.

Also, it needs a one-move Undo button... you can completely ruin your game by combining the pieces in the wrong direction - it happens too often for me.

Gameplay is very, very good - plays like the Triple Town genre, but you ‚Äúseed‚Äù new tiles instead of them generating randomly, and your worst enemy is a countdown clock (you‚Äôre always limited to a certain number of turns that you can increase through matching)... it makes this game very unique.

I don‚Äôt usually write reviews, but I love this game. Just finished it and am so touched by the beautiful, surprising end. I would have given 5 stars just for the puzzle aspect. Some have said it‚Äôs repetitive, but each stage of the game expands the play, and the puzzle. So yeah, an excellent game.

title.label: There‚Äôs minimalism and then there‚Äôs this.

content.label:
It‚Äôs a beautiful and interesting game, but the lack of any instruction or guidance is frustrating and definitely not relaxing. Even just a ‚Äòhelp‚Äô section hidden on the menu would be nice, or maybe a hint after playing the first level 8 times without progress. These additions would at least have given me hope that I hadn‚Äôt spent 6 dollars on a single level in a hex mini game.

More about the gameplay for anyone interested: To progress to new content, you have to copy the pattern displayed in a thought bubble. The types of plants you need to fulfill the pattern are displayed on a hex board filled with a rotating diagram of the hex pattern needed with 2D silhouettes denoting the types of plants necessary. The actual game board does not rotate and all plants are three dimensional shapes. It‚Äôs difficult to get perspective on where the pattern is possible on the actual game board as a result.

It‚Äôs just 2048 with some new mechanics and graphics that kill your phone twice as fast. There‚Äôs no ‚Äúnarrative‚Äù portion, just a myst-esque overworld with some buttons you have to click on to progress and some vague gameplay hints. Too expensive to be worth it.
If you hold your left thumb on inventory and tap on a song you can load as many as you want.
This game wasnt what i expected and i would like my money returned. Thank you in advance.

This may be my favorite game ever! I love puzzle and strategy games, but it‚Äôs so hard to find games that hold my attention and make me want to keep playing. After the first few times playing, this absolutely gorgeous game had me completely hooked, and although I‚Äôve played to the end, I‚Äôm still hooked! The puzzle aspect mixed of the game with the strategy of the map was perfect. The final scene in the map was so moving. Having read the story behind the game in TouchArcade, and that the game was made to honor the creators‚Äô mother (my own father passed away unexpectedly 2  months ago), it really touched me, and I‚Äôll have to admit, I teared up at the end. I could go on and on about this game, I highly recommend it.

First of all... I think most glowing positive reviews here are fake. The game started interesting, liked that there is a story or a goal. And it was satisfying. You basically get to the ‚Äúend‚Äù relatively quick. Then you basically keep solving more and more puzzles for no apparent purpose or ‚Äúreward‚Äù. Uninstalling...
It‚Äôs a well made game and it looks great, but the puzzles and flower mini-game are pretty repetitive.  Almost a great game.
Seems like a good game but it shuts my phone screen off randomly. Pretty annoying because it comes back on a couple seconds later

This game is the best, relaxing puzzler I‚Äôve played in a while. It‚Äôs intuitive, well paced, and worth every penny. My only complaint is that the game now shuts down when loading new game boards. Help!
I am not usually a fan of puzzle games, but this one is beautiful both visually and musically. It enchants me, and I like the sense of story and journey it invokes. Highly recommend.
I love how this game takes the fundamentals from games like Triple Town but then evolves them into something totally unique!
What a great game. Makes you feel like success and relaxation can be one in the same - gorgeous as well. Definitely in my top games of the year list.

Wow, I really regret spending money on this. It‚Äôs essentially a match-based puzzle game where you can spread flower tiles to neighboring tiles using seeds. It claims to contain some sort of narrative, but it‚Äôs light / completely absent depending on how much you decide to read into context clues. It doesn‚Äôt feel satisfying to solve puzzles, and there‚Äôs no reward for doing well other than more puzzle tiles. I don‚Äôt know how the dev rationalizes the price with the gameplay being as shallow as it is. Bleh. Bad purchase.
This game is so much fun! I‚Äôve never just been able to relax and play a game like this before! It‚Äôs so peaceful and the soundtrack is amazing!! Love it!!
The further you get into the game, the more you discover new ways to play it. Great concept. Will be putting some hours in. Also, it has a great story line!
The game has stunning visuals, challenging puzzles, and loads of fun. Once you settle into the game you‚Äôll find that you‚Äôll have a hard time walking away! Worth every penny!

Evergarden is a great game that is easy to pick up. I love that it‚Äôs simple enough for my five-year-old to play, but deep enough for someone older, like me, to keep things interesting and really challenge the mind.
Just when I thought I had figured out how the game works, new gameplay is introduced. 
The sounds are very calming and a great reward when advancing through rounds. 
I recommend this game for anyone looking for a strategy game that doesn‚Äôt require a huge time commitment, even though it will keep you entertained for hours at a time.
Finally! A different sort of puzzle game! Fantastic little story and unique gameplay make this something worth buying. No annoying ads. No in app purchases. Just an honest, great, game. Bravo.

title.label: Found my new favorite puzzle game

content.label: Beautiful puzzle game. Looks and sounds fantastic. The game doesn‚Äôt hold your hand and lets you figure things out on your own. I love that. I‚Äôm going to sink so much time into this game. Worth the price.

Evergarden is beautiful, charming, and above all, fun. It has elements of puzzle play, strategy, and logic. Like most of my favorite games, the mechanics are simple but there is depth that comes with discovery of what you can do in this world. Highly recommended!

This game is so amazing! It‚Äôs peaceful, entertaining, and it doesn‚Äôt push you to rate it!
No ads, beautiful visuals, and sooooo much more!!! I highly recommend you buy it. It‚Äôs a bit pricey but it‚Äôs so worth it!
